hero.subline: Full-stack Web & Java developer – I create efficient, scalable, and maintainable applications for the web and desktop.

texts.intro: I’m a developer with a strong interest in building clean, interactive, and technically well-structured applications. My main focus is modern web development and Java-based projects, with an emphasis on performance and maintainability.
texts.techStack: I primarily work with these technologies:

origin.p: I started programming with Fischertechnik at the age of ten. When the COVID pandemic began, my interest deepened further. Since my mother is a teacher and attended various online training sessions, one of which introduced the programming language Java, I followed along out of curiosity. I found the topic fascinating and soon began exploring Java on my own. Over time, this foundation led me to broaden my skill set, and I went on to learn HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and later TypeScript, with a growing focus on web development and interactive applications.

interests.p: I enjoy working on projects where logic and creativity meet. This includes canvas-based applications, small games, tools, and systems that require thoughtful architecture rather than just visual polish.
I particularly like projects where I can control the full stack or the full rendering pipeline, as it allows me to optimize performance and understand every part of the system.

learning.p: I learn primarily by building real projects. Instead of following tutorials step by step, I prefer to experiment, research problems as they arise, and refine my solutions through iteration.
I actively explore new technologies, read documentation, analyze existing implementations, and apply what I learn directly to my own projects.

texts.goals: My goal is to continue growing as a developer by working on technically challenging projects and deepening my understanding of software architecture, performance optimization, and low-level concepts.
